summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 between the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS). The OIG is forwarding a question from its headquarters regarding whether SDNY had requirements to memorialize Jeffrey Epstein's phone calls related to his underlying case and if those requirements were followed.
keyFacts: The Office of the Inspector General (OIG) was inquiring about procedures related to Jeffrey Epstein's case in August 2019.
The inquiry specifically asked if the Southern District of New York (SDNY) had requirements to 'memorialize' Epstein's phone calls related to his underlying case.
The OIG asked whether any such requirements were followed.
The email exchange occurred on August 16-17, 2019, shortly after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, suggesting post-mortem procedural review.
